item.title: Tournament Method
item.description: This involves dividing the array in two pieces until there are only 2 elements remaining, Off of which the comparison returns the pair of minima and maxima to which the preceding call compares the returned minima and maxima and continues until it reaches the end of the array

item.title: 1879 Rigged!
item.description: Monocarp organizes a weightlifting competition. There are n athletes participating in the competition, the i-th athlete has strength si and endurance ei.

item.title: 1D Eraser
item.description: You are given a strip of paper $s$ that is $n$ cells long. Each cell is either black or white. In an operation you can take any $k$ consecutive cells and make them all white.

item.title: 3. Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
item.description: Given a stringÂ s, find the length of theÂ longestÂ substring without repeating characters. Example 1: Input: s = “abcabcbb” Output: 3 Explanation: The answer is “abc”, with the length of 3.

item.title: 4. Median of Two Sorted Arrays
item.description: Given two sorted arraysÂ nums1Â andÂ nums2Â of sizeÂ mÂ andÂ nÂ respectively, returnÂ the medianÂ of the two sorted arrays.
